newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Brokers uncertain on Nordbanken share dip.
newsitem.headline: Brokers uncertain on Nordbanken share dip.

text.p: A fall in the share price of Swedish state-controlled bank Nordbanken on Thursday could not easily be explained, brokers said.
At 1415 GMT the bank's share price was 9.5 crowns lower at 257.5, a dip of 3.5 percent against a general market index fall of 0.67 percent.
"It is a boring day on the bourse and most people are hanging back. A large sale can put pressure on the share price," one broker said.
Nordbanken's managing director Hans Dalborg said on Thursday that he was prepared to go back into merger negotiations with S-E-Banken if the banks' owners agreed.
S-E-Banken shares were 0.5 higher at 83.50 crowns.
"Perhaps the market thinks that Nordbanken will make a rather expensive bid for S-E-Banken which could affect the share price but this is pure speculation," another broker said.
